data.quote: Doubt is the father of invention.

data.quote: There's basically an element of fiction in everything you remember. Imagination and memory are almost the same brain processes. data.quote: Superheroes are best imagined in comic books. The union between the written word, the image, and then what your imagination has to do to connect those allows for so much.
data.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

data.quote: When I see Bruce Banner becoming the Hulk, it's only a picture. My imagination has to do some of the work there, to impute feeling and everything. We're talking about something that's so surreal, it's just not possible within the world as we know it. So that requires a form that is not so literal.
data.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

data.quote: The imagination is part of the arsenal that actors draw from.
data.author: Bryan Cranston

data.quote: 'Castle' is a guy living in a fantasy world. He's in his imagination, writing these stories of murder.
data.author: Nathan Fillion

data.quote: I think my printing to this day looks like the printing right out of a comic book. Actually, I always wanted to be in a comic book. I watched cartoons when I was a kid, too, and both comics and cartoons lit fire in my imagination. This realm holds a lot of interest for me, a lot of passion for me. So to be comic-ized, yeah, that's cool.
data.author: Nathan Fillion

data.quote: There's the argument that you can relate to someone who's completely unrelatable. In the way that a director shows you his imagination on a film, then I get to show you my imagination in a big dumb character.
data.author: Idris Elba

data.quote: I have always thought that the place where you sleep or the place you share with your partner should be separate from the place where you write. The domestic rituals and details somehow kill the imagination. They kill the demon in me.
data.author: Orhan Pamuk

data.quote: Authoritarianism, an unrealistic occidental imagination - these issues will never be settled. Turkey will continue to take Europe as a model; it will continue to pursue its search for democracy.
data.author: Orhan Pamuk

data.quote: The scientific imagination always restrains itself within the limits of probability.
data.author: Thomas Huxley

data.quote: It's amazing what you can do with an E in A-Level art, a twisted imagination and a chainsaw.
data.author: Damien Hirst

data.quote: Visualization - it's been huge for me. Your mind doesn't know the difference between imagination and reality. You can't always practice perfectly - my fingers will play a little bit out of tune, or my dance moves might not be as sharp - but in my mind, I can practice perfectly.
data.author: Lindsey Stirling

data.quote: The pleasures of the imagination are as it were only drawings and models which are played with by poor people who cannot afford the real thing.
data.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

data.quote: Art is about imagination. When you look at a picture from Salvador Dali, that's about imagination. When you look at Picasso, that's about imagination. Doing stuff from your heart.
data.author: LL Cool J

data.quote: I do like to wrap things up and leave some things to the readers' imagination.
data.author: Rick Riordan

data.quote: Solitude is as needful to the imagination as society is wholesome for the character.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: I think imagination is a crazy thing, and that's what makes the world go around.
data.author: Shahid Khan

data.quote: New York, for decades, offered a perpetual series of 'golden ages' to artists. You constantly had to measure yourself against the best, and you had to watch them, which meant that your imagination and also your sense of what the market could stand got very, very sharp.
data.author: Margo Jefferson

data.quote: There aren't any fences to the imagination, and so there shouldn't be any for books.
data.author: Matt Haig

data.quote: You always need that spark of imagination. Sometimes I'm midway through a book before it happens. However, I don't wait for the muse to descend, I sit down every day and I work when I'm not delivering lambs on the farm.
data.author: Barbara Kingsolver

data.quote: We have to learn not to feel guilty about letting our imagination browse around, and you know, in writing fiction particularly. But I think, in any kind of writing, we have to learn to allow ourselves to approach it in a contemplative way.
data.author: Sue Monk Kidd

data.quote: I may have been sexy, but I was covered up total. There was something left to the imagination.
data.author: Suzi Quatro

data.quote: Most of the songs I write are just very directly from my life. I don't have a big imagination. Whenever I tried to write from fantasy, it comes out sounding really fake.
data.author: Rivers Cuomo

data.quote: Everything you do on set is directly related to your imagination when you read the script for the first time.
data.author: Ewan McGregor

data.quote: I'm not a passive person by any stretch of the imagination.
data.author: Courteney Cox

data.quote: Belief is nothing but a more vivid, lively, forcible, firm, steady conception of an object, than what the imagination alone is ever able to attain.
data.author: David Hume

data.quote: It's what you don't see that keeps you on the edge of your seat in any kind of film - leave it to the imagination of the viewer.
data.author: Christopher Lee

data.quote: Sometimes a character is really based on research that you do. Other times it's just based on your imagination or perhaps your conversation with the director. Or sometimes all of the above. It depends on the movie and character.
data.author: Joaquin Phoenix

data.quote: I guess I'm a very keen observer, and I'd like to think I have a good imagination.
data.author: Eric Bana

data.quote: I feel like 'Amelie' is very much an extension of me. She's a contemporary woman who sees the world through her imagination.
data.author: Phillipa Soo

data.quote: Everything is creative. It's all relative to me. No matter what, you've gotta use your imagination, use your senses.
data.author: Action Bronson

data.quote: Theatre is about the collective imagination... Everything I use on-stage is driven by the subject matter and what you might call the text - but that text can be anything, from a fragment of movement or music to something you see on a TV.
data.author: Simon McBurney

data.quote: I remember the fact that milk was delivered every day by a milkman. In summer, my mother would make what now seem in my middle-aged imagination the most delicious iced milkshakes.
data.author: Simon McBurney

data.quote: I made a real specific decision when I came out of school and most artists were writing about home - if you were a woman, you were writing about being a woman - and I decided not to do that, write about what you know. That's not what I do. I went as far away from home as possible in terms of the development of my imagination.
data.author: Anna Deavere Smith

data.quote: Television contracts the imagination and radio expands it.
data.author: Terry Wogan

data.quote: I think because I try to keep things as real as I can, or I try to start from a place of reality, I almost don't have the imagination to write a book that's not set where I am.
data.author: Maria Semple

data.quote: Some of us are interested in directors, but really the vast majority of us are interested in actors. You experience the films through the actors, so they're all locked into your imagination in some kind of layer of fantasy or hatred or wherever they settle into your imagination.
data.author: Danny Boyle

data.quote: You experience the films through the actors, so they're all locked into your imagination in some kind of layer of fantasy or hatred or wherever they settle into your imagination.
data.author: Danny Boyle

data.quote: The aspect of kind of living in your imagination and creating a more romantic vision of the world than the reality that you're given - that's definitely something I can sort of relate to.
data.author: Alden Ehrenreich

data.quote: With any kind of sci-fi, the imagination continues, and the world exists, and you create that in your own mind, and it lives in you.
data.author: Scott Bakula

data.quote: My mother always cultivated my imagination from the time I was very little.
data.author: Alden Ehrenreich

data.quote: If you use your imagination, you can look at any actress and see her nude... I hope to make you use your imagination.
data.author: Hedy Lamarr

data.quote: I never played Freddy as real. In the true bible of Wes Craven's outline for the films, Freddy only manifests himself in dreams. And a lot goes into a dream, not the least of which is imagination. So Freddy is secondhand information. Freddy is an urban legend that's been handed down to these teenagers over the years.
data.author: Robert Englund

data.quote: I started track and field when I was 12 and didn't get to an Olympic Games until I was nearly 23. By any stretch of the imagination that's a very long apprenticeship.
data.author: Sebastian Coe

data.quote: A man to carry on a successful business must have imagination. He must see things as in a vision, a dream of the whole thing.
data.author: Charles M. Schwab

data.quote: I saw that publishing all over the world was deeply constrained by self-censorship, economics and political censorship, while the military-industrial complex was growing at a tremendous rate, and the amount of information that it was collecting about all of us vastly exceeded the public imagination.
data.author: Julian Assange

data.quote: Once you've got a child to the point that they've discovered books, they're safe. There's a world of the imagination that when they're hurt or upset, they can move into, and it is wonderful.
data.author: John Rhys-Davies

data.quote: I love sci-fi because it leads in the imagination, and I always say it has the most intelligent fans in the world.
data.author: Robert Carlyle

data.quote: We didn't have all the distractions that young people have today. We didn't have these incredible computer games and social networks to engage with. I understand that. But once young readers do discover reading, when they discover a book which they fall in love with, it really unleashes something new in their imagination.
data.author: Mark Billingham

data.quote: A reader's own imagination is a far more powerful form of CGI than anything any movie can provide because it's unique. In your own imagination, you can enter all sorts of worlds, and they are unique to you because no other reader will interpret a book the same way.
data.author: Mark Billingham

data.quote: When France was the only reference for chefs to learn, you could go everywhere in the world, and they would copy dishes directly because they didn't have much expanded imagination or technique or knowledge.
data.author: Daniel Boulud

data.quote: The human imagination... has great difficulty in living strictly within the confines of a materialist practice or philosophy. It dreams, like a dog in its basket, of hares in the open.
data.author: John Berger

data.quote: You get your heart stomped by the opposite sex, and you're hurting so badly that you write 'Sometimes When We Touch.' But then what happens when you've been married for 25 years? You can't rely on those emotional male-female roller coasters. You have to start using your imagination and the powers of empathy more.
data.author: Dan Hill

data.quote: The more ships have grown in size and consequence, the more their place in our imagination has shrunk.
data.author: Rose George

data.quote: Never forget that the truest luxury is imagination, and that being a writer gives you the leeway to exploit all of the imagination's curious intricacies, to be what you were, what you are, what you will be, and what everyone else is or was or will be, too.
data.author: Andrew Solomon

data.quote: I have a very vivid imagination.
data.author: Janice Dickinson

data.quote: You have to imagine it possible before you can see something. You can have the evidence right in front of you, but if you can't imagine something that has never existed before, it's impossible.
data.author: Rita Dove

data.quote: Fools act on imagination without knowledge, pedants act on knowledge without imagination.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: I sometimes say that I don't make anything up - obviously that's not true. But I am uninterested in writers who say that everything comes out of the imagination. I would rather be in a room with someone who is telling the story of his life, which may be exaggerated and even have lies in it, but I want to hear the true story, essentially.
data.author: James Salter

data.quote: I have never been able to pay attention to anything for more than a few minutes - the stories in my head have always been so much more entertaining. Only books could pull me out of my own imagination, and then it was only to plunge me into someone else's.
data.author: W. Bruce Cameron

data.quote: For someone who writes fiction, in order to activate the imagination and the unconscious, it's essential to be free.
data.author: Manuel Puig

data.quote: It was just very interesting to me that certain types of women inspire people's imagination, and all of them were very difficult women.
data.author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

data.quote: My imagination, my ability to understand the way love and people grow over time, how passion can surprise and renew, utterly failed me.
data.author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

data.quote: Possessing a healthy imagination is a necessary ingredient for creativity.
data.author: Steve Vai

data.quote: There are one or two very good women military historians who use imagination, great study and research; they can put themselves in the boots of the soldier.
data.author: Antony Beevor

data.quote: I just love music - by no stretch of the imagination am I professionally competent.
data.author: Vikram Seth

data.quote: I understand what it is to go through emotional trauma and retreat and go into the world of your imagination. I understand how art and music can be a place of safety in a world of reinvention.
data.author: Sam Taylor-Wood

data.quote: I live in words. I like looking at things, but I don't have a strong visual imagination.
data.author: Colm Toibin

data.quote: I think what's really the most ideal thing is for the player themselves, within their own imagination, to carve out what they view as being the essence of the character.
data.author: Shigeru Miyamoto

data.quote: Being an actor means asking people to look at you. I guess I accept that. But it's a profession in which the job is to show another world and other people. You may access it through bits of yourself, and your imagination and experience, but actually, in the end, you're not playing yourself.
data.author: Ralph Fiennes

data.quote: I find Godzilla exciting because he/she/it comes from the sea. It's entirely plausible that it could be real. Yes it is! It doesn't take a huge stretch in the imagination to imagine that something may be living at the deepest depths of one of our oceans.
data.author: Rhys Darby

data.quote: Every time you get on a stage or in front of a camera, the whole exercise is about imagination. You're constantly depicting something that doesn't exist, and trying to find the reality of it. Once you settle on that premise, everything else is a matter of degrees.
data.author: Ron Perlman

data.quote: The Polar Express is about faith, and the power of imagination to sustain faith. It's also about the desire to reside in a world where magic can happen, the kind of world we all believed in as children, but one that disappears as we grow older.
data.author: Chris Van Allsburg

data.quote: The general effect of viewing 'Jumanji' is thrilling. I was able to see on film a thing that at one point had only existed in my imagination. I got to see the images from my book come alive.
data.author: Chris Van Allsburg

data.quote: There is nothing heavier than compassion. Not even one's own pain weighs so heavy as the pain one feels for someone, for someone, pain intensified by the imagination and prolonged by a hundred echos.
data.author: Milan Kundera

data.quote: I enjoy working on a movie that lets your imagination run wild, it's great to be a part of and watch.
data.author: Chris Hemsworth

data.quote: When I was a teenager, reading for me was as normal, as unremarkable as eating or breathing. Reading gave flight to my imagination and strengthened my understanding of the world, the society I lived in, and myself. More importantly, reading was fun, a way to live more than one life as I immersed myself in each good book I read.
data.author: Malorie Blackman

data.quote: Cynicism and naivety lie cheek by jowl in the American imagination; if the United States is one of the most venal nations on Earth, it is also one of the most earnestly idealistic.
data.author: Terry Eagleton

data.quote: I have been afraid all my life that I am going to die. All my life it has been stuffed in my imagination.
data.author: Patty Duke

data.quote: When I achieved the European record for reciting pi in 2004, this captured the imagination of Professor Simon Baron-Cohen in Cambridge, and he finally diagnosed me with Asperger's that year.
data.author: Daniel Tammet

data.quote: If when we are taught English we are just taught the rules of grammar, it would take all our love of our language away from us. What makes us love a subject like English is when we learn all these fantastic stories. Feeding the imagination is what makes a subject come alive.
data.author: Daniel Tammet

data.quote: I think most of the time you can make something happen, and it's about not letting your imagination be limited by that.
data.author: Jane Goldman

data.quote: Imagination is Reality Lite - a useful substitute when the real pleasure is inaccessible, too risky, or too much work.
data.author: Paul Bloom

data.quote: Imagination tends to be truly useful if accompanied by the power of mental control - if the worlds in one's head can be purposefully manipulated and distinguished from the real one outside it.
data.author: Paul Bloom

data.quote: I box two to three times a week. I don't like going to the gym because it's boring. I really like boxing because you have to combine concentration and imagination. I feel like I'm actually learning something that's useful.
data.author: Stephanie Sigman

data.quote: People who don't see their nature and imagine they can practice thoughtlessness all the time are lairs and fools.
data.author: Bodhidharma

data.quote: Toy Soldiers was my introduction to film. I certainly didn't think I was doing art by any stretch of the imagination.
data.author: Tim Robbins

data.quote: I can get very philosophical and ask the questions Keats was asking as a young guy. What are we here for? What's a soul? What's it all about? What is thinking about, imagination?
data.author: Jane Campion

data.quote: There's no artist in this world that doesn't enjoy the dream that if they have bad reviews now, the story of Keats can redeem them, in their fantasy or imagination, in the future. I think Keats' poem 'Endymion' is a really difficult poem, and I'm not surprised that a lot of people pulled it apart in a way.
data.author: Jane Campion

data.quote: I feel that directors at times are like the janitors on the set. I am the secretary, I am the organizer, I am the maid, and I ask if they have eaten or rested. The best things are always out of your control. It's those moments that surpass the imagination that are thrilling.
data.author: Jane Campion

data.quote: God has given us an imagination, and our imagination is really the principle tool from which all creativity and artistry comes from.
data.author: Erwin McManus

data.quote: You can have 10 bucks to 10 million bucks and if you got a crew, imagination and a lot of people willing to turn in some work next to nothing, you going to have a feature. But you can't get beyond how expensive marketing the movie is, it's so crushing.
data.author: Kevin Smith

data.quote: As an actor you have to have a strong vivid imagination as you're working and when the camera's rolling, but there's certainly a part of you that is aware of real life, that you're making a movie.
data.author: John Hawkes

data.quote: For memory, we use our imagination. We take a few strands of real time and carry them with us, then like an oyster we create a pearl around them.
data.author: John Banville

data.quote: The first piece of music that captured my imagination was probably Ray Charles Live At Newport.
data.author: Van Morrison

data.quote: Learn to see things as they really are, not as we imagine they are.
data.author: Vernon Howard

data.quote: Reason respects the differences, and imagination the similitudes of things.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: If the reporter has killed our imagination with his truth, he threatens our life with his lies.
data.author: Karl Kraus

data.quote: There's no reason for your imagination to be fettered by money.
data.author: Kevin McCloud

data.quote: I have a vivid, apocalyptic imagination.
data.author: Sally Mann

data.quote: There's just so many great stories in the past that you can know a little bit about, but you can't know it all, and that's where imagination can work.
data.author: Geraldine Brooks

data.quote: My greatest strength as a child, I realize now, was my imagination. While every other kid was reading and writing, I had seven whole hours a day to practice my imagination. When do you get that space in your life, ever?
data.author: Barbara Corcoran

data.quote: Writing is a mysterious process, and many ideas come from deep within the imagination, so it's very hard to say how characters come about. Mostly, they just happen.
data.author: Michelle Paver

data.quote: All the best have something in common, a regard for reality, an agreement to its primacy over the imagination.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: Politics is the enemy of the imagination.
data.author: Ian Mcewan

data.quote: The goal of 'Data Detectives' is to spark the imagination of students around the globe by making them think about new technologies that will impact humanity in ways similar to language and art.
data.author: Rick Smolan

data.quote: For a 12-year-old with a hyperactive imagination who liked to dream of dreary gothic castles, suburban Florida felt a little stifling.
data.author: Ransom Riggs

data.quote: My books are elegiac in the sense that they're odes to a nation that even I sometimes think may not exist anymore except in my memory and my imagination.
data.author: Richard Russo

data.quote: All of the stuff I can't afford to do on a TV budget, I just put into the comic book because you're really only limited in a comic by your artist's imagination.
data.author: Marc Guggenheim

data.quote: Any acting is a stretch of the imagination. That's your job. Acting is truth in imaginary circumstances. Acting with green screen or a motion capture stage, you're striving for absolute truth in absolutely imaginary circumstances.
data.author: Sam Worthington

data.quote: To me, stretching the capabilities of my imagination is a crucial aspect of writing fiction; you could think of it as a mental form of athleticism.
data.author: Julia Glass

data.quote: As a little girl, my destiny was stamped onto the canvas of my imagination at 5 years old. I was watching soaps with my grandmother... The most gorgeous black women I had ever seen in my life came out, and I knew that that is what I wanted to do - be fabulous and black and on TV.
data.author: Niecy Nash

data.quote: When you are a people's movement, you have one thing. Your only asset is people. And you have to deal with real people. Not the people of your imagination. Not the people you wish people would be. But people as they exist actually out there in the real world.
data.author: Norman Finkelstein

data.quote: Three centuries after the appearance of Franklin's 'Courant', it no longer requires a dystopic imagination to wonder who will have the dubious distinction of publishing America's last genuine newspaper. Few believe that newspapers in their current printed form will survive.
data.author: Eric Alterman

data.quote: I guess just a lively imagination is the best effort an actor can have.
data.author: Jacki Weaver

data.quote: There's something magical about a home run. It almost violates the space of the stadium. It's a game of the imagination in some ways. Baseball.
data.author: Alex Gibney

data.quote: Radio listeners often have a very fertile imagination when it comes to body shape.
data.author: Tamsin Greig

data.quote: I believed in myself. I never imagined myself as just an ordinary player.
data.author: Imran Khan

data.quote: If my accent betrayed my foreign birth, it also stamped me as an enemy, in the imagination of the producers.
data.author: Bela Lugosi

data.quote: I always won in my imagination. I always hit the game-winning shot, or I hit the free throw. Or if I missed, there was a lane violation, and I was given another one.
data.author: Mike Krzyzewski

data.quote: Imagination has a great deal to do with winning.
data.author: Mike Krzyzewski

data.quote: To say that such-and-such a circumstance is 'Kafkaesque' is to admit to the denigration of an imagination that has burned a hole in what we take to be modernism - even in what we take to be the ordinary fabric and intent of language. Nothing is like 'The Hunger Artist.' Nothing is like 'The Metamorphosis.'
data.author: Cynthia Ozick

data.quote: I don't agree with the sentiment 'write what you know.'... I think one should write what one doesn't know. The world is bigger and wider and more complex than our small subjective selves. One should prod, goad the imagination.
data.author: Cynthia Ozick

data.quote: My children have been all over the world, and I think it's so good for them: expanding their horizons and imagination and seeing how other people live.
data.author: Keeley Hawes

data.quote: London has always provided the landscape for my imagination. It becomes a character - a living being - within each of my books.
data.author: Peter Ackroyd

data.quote: I have always believed that the material world is governed by nonmaterial sources, so that in that sense 'English Music' is an exercise in the spiritual as well as the material. I have always been attracted to the Gothic and spiritual imagination, and I've always been interested in visionaries.
data.author: Peter Ackroyd

data.quote: When I was a boy, I was a worrier, and so was my son, Joe. I used to tell him that worrying meant he had an imagination and that one day he'd be pleased.
data.author: Anthony Browne

data.quote: Inspiring passion in children for books, and the world of imagination and creativity fuelled by them, is a fundamental reason for why the Children's Laureate post exists.
data.author: Anthony Browne

data.quote: Picture books are for everybody at any age, not books to be left behind as we grow older. The best ones leave a tantalising gap between the pictures and the words, a gap that is filled by the reader's imagination, adding so much to the excitement of reading a book.
data.author: Anthony Browne

data.quote: There's so much more that I want to do. Of course it's great what has happened so far: Ultra, Coachella, EDC. But still, production-wise and show-wise, I'd love to play a show at Madison Square Garden. Stuff like that is beyond my imagination.
data.author: Martin Garrix

data.quote: My daughter has a vivid imagination, and so does my son.
data.author: Nicole Ari Parker

data.quote: Every parent knows this moment in a child's age when he or she needs your attention in a very specific way because it's the beginning and ending of the early life of imagination. It's such a responsibility.
data.author: Nicole Ari Parker

data.quote: I still have a photo on my wall of the greatest idol I will ever have in my life, and it's myself at eight. Because that's when the forces of imagination have the same value as the real world, when they're an instrument of survival: when my mother disappeared, and I imagined a mother. That was me at my best.
data.author: Henning Mankell

data.quote: Humiliating events have a way of capturing the public's imagination. So it has been since antiquity, when gladiators were pitted against each other and the legions of Spartacus were crucified in endless rows on the way to Rome.
data.author: Gary Weiss

data.quote: I became a novelist because of 'Gone With the Wind,' or more precisely, my mother raised me up to be a 'Southern' novelist, with a strong emphasis on the word 'Southern' because 'Gone With the Wind' set my mother's imagination ablaze when she was a young girl growing up in Atlanta.
data.author: Pat Conroy

data.quote: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: My approach as an actor has always been the same, in that the greatest gift that you're ever going to have is your imagination because you're not going to have all life experiences. So you draw on things that are sort of close to it but you spend your time expanding on it or drawing something specific on whatever your situation is.
data.author: Vince Vaughn

data.quote: I do as much comedy as I possibly can, but I'm basically limited by the imagination of the secretaries who make the decisions.
data.author: Rufus Sewell

data.quote: Only World War II, which mobilized 10 million draftees, could by any stretch of the imagination be called a people's war.
data.author: John Gregory Dunne

data.quote: I've been working on the soprano saxophone for 40 years, and the possibilities are astounding. It's up to you, the only limit is the imagination.
data.author: Steve Lacy

data.quote: I deeply adored my mum. She was an extraordinary person, even for the prejudice I'm likely to have. She was beautiful, amusing, a tremendous elaborator of things into comic proportions and extravagant in her imagination.
data.author: Andrew Motion

data.quote: I have an active imagination.
data.author: Anya Taylor-Joy

data.quote: Reading changes your perspective and feeds your imagination.
data.author: Najat Vallaud-Belkacem

data.quote: I like to have a thing suggested rather than told in full. When every detail is given, the mind rests satisfied, and the imagination loses the desire to use its own wings.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: Dwellers by the sea are generally superstitious sailors always are. There is something in the illimitable expanse of sky and water that dilates the imagination.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: To my mind the boy who gives least promise is one in whom the critical faculty develops in advance of the imagination.
data.author: Quintilian

data.quote: Life-writing calls for any number of dubious gifts: A touch of O.C.D., a lack of imagination, a large desk, neutrality of Swiss proportions, tactlessness, a high tolerance for archival dust. Most of all it calls for an act of displacement. 'To find your subject, you must in some sense lose yourself along the way,' is Richard Holmes's version.
data.author: Stacy Schiff

data.quote: I ask questions. I watch the world. And what I have discovered is that the parts of my fiction that people most tell me are 'unbelievable' are those that are most closely based on the real, those least diluted by my imagination.
data.author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

data.quote: I just can't afford to get bored, because if you've been blessed with a generous imagination, which a lot of actors have, to be engaged, to be stimulated, is to liberate your imagination.
data.author: John C. McGinley

data.quote: To be in a show like 'Miranda' that captures everyone's imagination is amazing, but it's hard when people can't see beyond that. I started travelling to North America because 'Miranda' was so popular in the U.K.; I always knew I wanted to challenge myself and not go for the obvious roles.
data.author: Tom Ellis

data.quote: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.
data.author: Vladimir Nabokov

data.quote: I use a lot of film images, analogies, and imagination.
data.author: Carlos Fuentes

data.quote: I feel very giddy with the idea of making my imagination take form and being able to put on a show where people leave feeling like they've experienced something.
data.author: Carly Rae Jepsen

data.quote: We are fascinated with our own history, and we are fascinated with the Romans because they were millennia ago, and yet they still capture our imagination because they were actually so similar to us. They were very civilized. They had a very similar political system.
data.author: Kit Harington

data.quote: I write from my imagination, not from what I've read in books or seen on TV or to make money. I wrote from an idea I was passionate about.
data.author: Dirk Benedict

data.quote: They seem much rarer now, those auteur films that come out of a director's imagination and are elliptical and hermetic. All those films that got me into independent cinema when I was watching it seem thin on the ground.
data.author: Toby Jones

data.quote: The idea was always going to be that each year is a stand-alone story, which did make it easier on some level. It also requires the network to have the creative imagination to say, 'This is also 'Fargo,' you know what I mean?
data.author: Noah Hawley

data.quote: Meeting Australian mountaineer and author Tim Macartney-Snape when I was 16 in 1994 had a big impact on me. His ascent of Everest from sea to summit captured my imagination.
data.author: Tim Cope

data.quote: An idea is a putting truth in check-mate.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: The imagination is man's power over nature.
data.author: Wallace Stevens

data.quote: To regard the imagination as metaphysics is to think of it as part of life, and to think of it as part of life is to realize the extent of artifice. We live in the mind.
data.author: Wallace Stevens

data.quote: I'm an emotional sort of person in general and I have a vivid imagination, so I feel the whole spectrum of emotion strongly when I write.
data.author: Erin Morgenstern

data.quote: My favorite literature to read is fairly dry history. I like the framework, and my imagination can do the rest.
data.author: Andrew Bird

data.quote: You have to just go with your imagination, where your instinct takes you.
data.author: Peter Mullan

data.quote: Your primary tools, as an actor, are observation and imagination. You can pretty much get everything you need from that, and you do. It brings back that element of pretend.
data.author: Stephen Lang

data.quote: On some level, acting is the art of pretend, and you have to have a highly cultivated sense of imagination. You have to be able to see things that aren't there, no matter what aspect of acting, whether it's green screen, whether it's on stage, whether it's anything else, whether you're working on the radio.
data.author: Stephen Lang

data.quote: The nomads' egalitarian lifestyle astonished the Greeks, who kept their own women indoors weaving and minding children. The exotic Scythian lifestyle fueled the Greek imagination and led to an outpouring of myths about fierce Amazons, 'the equals of men.'
data.author: Adrienne Mayor

data.quote: We know their names: Hippolyta, Antiope, Thessalia. But they were long thought to be just travelers' tales or products of the Greek storytelling imagination. A lot of scholars still argue that. But archaeology has now proven without a doubt that there really were women fitting the description that the Greeks gave us of Amazons and warrior women.
data.author: Adrienne Mayor

data.quote: The opportunities of man are limited only by his imagination. But so few have imagination that there are ten thousand fiddlers to one composer.
data.author: Charles Kettering

data.quote: Ideas control the world.
data.author: James A. Garfield

data.quote: In an era of parental paranoia, lawsuit mania and testing frenzy, we are failing to inspire our children's curiosity, creativity, and imagination. We are denying them opportunities to tinker, discover, and explore - in short, to play.
data.author: Darell Hammond

data.quote: Ultimately, so much Dr. Seuss is about empowerment. He invites us to disappear into our imagination and then blows the doors off what that can mean.
data.author: Gary Ross

data.quote: Imagination creates some big monsters.
data.author: Olivier Martinez

data.quote: A young imagination is bold, likes to make bigger leaps. It likes to, well, imagine that the dustbuster is a dinosaur; that the computer mouse is a hotrod; that the box is a cave; that the rawhide is a torch... or a baton... or something.
data.author: Mo Rocca

data.quote: I like to build a character, trying to stretch my imagination as far to the walls of my brain as I can to come up with something that feels truthful and feels real - as close to the skin as I can get it.
data.author: Uzo Aduba

data.quote: I think of myself as a little kid, and I had a wild imagination, but it was something that was encouraged and supported, which helped steer me into the arts.
data.author: Uzo Aduba

data.quote: Love is based on imagination.
data.author: Olivier Martinez

data.quote: But in my imagination this whole thing developed and I started mixing up old folk songs with the Beatles beat and taking them down to Greenwich Village and playing them for the people there.
data.author: Roger McGuinn

data.quote: I sort of jumped out of movies and into the lifeboat of comics. I loved it right away. It was the opposite of film school. Whatever was in my imagination could end up in the finished product. There were just no limitations.
data.author: Brian K. Vaughan

data.quote: That was the appealing thing about comics: There literally is no budget in comics. You're only limited by your imagination.
data.author: Brian K. Vaughan

data.quote: Let's be clear - for people like me, who are obsessed with story and for whom words are their medium, writing is the best job possible. I work hard, but I earn more than the national average wage while I play with my imagination, and for me, that's a dream.
data.author: Sara Sheridan

data.quote: I used to write stories a lot because you had to fill your hours some other way than watching television. So my imagination was vivid, and I used to write a lot of stories. I wrote a novel, which I still have, which is so awful.
data.author: Robert Osborne

data.quote: Imagination is not the exclusive appanage of artists, but belongs in varying degrees to all men.
data.author: George Henry Lewes

data.quote: Philosophy and Art both render the invisible visible by imagination.
data.author: George Henry Lewes

data.quote: Clearly, some creative thinking is badly needed if humans are to have a future beyond Earth. Returning to the Moon may be worthy and attainable, but it fails to capture the public's imagination. What does get people excited is the prospect of a mission to Mars.
data.author: Paul Davies

data.quote: I feel like the Internet needs to be disarmed in some way. There needs to be a philosophical undermining of the Internet. We take it too seriously and too literally. For a reference we go to Wikipedia, which is full of inaccuracies and misinformation. It's kind of beautiful - it's all the product of imagination; it's not reality at all.
data.author: Sufjan Stevens

data.quote: When I start a picture, I always have a script, but I change it every day. I put in what occurs to me that day out of my imagination. You start on a voyage; you know where you will end up but not what will occur along the way. You want to be surprised.
data.author: Federico Fellini

data.quote: You will obtain a vision of matter that is perhaps fatiguing for your imagination, but pure and stripped of what the requirements of life make you add to it in external perception.
data.author: Henri Bergson

data.quote: Classical plays require more imagination and more general training to be able to do. That's why I like playing Shakespeare better than anything else.
data.author: Vivien Leigh

data.quote: I do not 'get' ideas ideas get me.
data.author: Robertson Davies

data.quote: All art, from the paintings on the walls of cave dwellers to art created today, is autobiographical because it comes from the secret place in the soul where imagination resides.
data.author: Gloria Vanderbilt

data.quote: We imagine that we want to escape our selfish and commonplace existence, but we cling desperately to our chains.
data.author: Anne Sullivan

data.quote: Trust that little voice in your head that says 'Wouldn't it be interesting if...' And then do it.
data.author: Duane Michals

data.quote: I believe in the imagination. What I cannot see is infinitely more important than what I can see.
data.author: Duane Michals

data.quote: In my imagination yes, I remember, when I was six years old, I was conducting all this concert in my house. But now it's real.
data.author: Gustavo Dudamel

data.quote: The peculiar fascination which the South held over my imagination and my limited capital decided me in favor of Atlanta University so about the last of September I bade farewell to the friends and scenes of my boyhood and boarded a train for the South.
data.author: James Weldon Johnson

data.quote: Suffering, it turns out, demands profound imagination. A new future has to be conjured up because the old future isn't there anymore.
data.author: Rob Bell

data.quote: I have an imagination because my life is so boring that my imagination lets me get off the reality of what's going on.
data.author: Dave Attell

data.quote: I used to lie in bed in my flat and imagine what would happen if there was a zombie attack.
data.author: Simon Pegg

data.quote: You need imagination in order to imagine a future that doesn't exist.
data.author: Azar Nafisi

data.quote: I try to decorate my imagination as much as I can.
data.author: Franz Schubert

data.quote: What does it mean to be Catholic and not a Catholic? I feel adrift, homeless. My Catholic imagination allows me to see the soul as a lit breath, seeking the divine. It persists.
data.author: Julianna Baggott

data.quote: I am putting real plums into an imaginary cake.
data.author: Mary McCarthy

data.quote: The violent quarrel between the abstractionists and the surrealists seems to me quite unnecessary. All good art has contained both abstract and surrealist elements, just as it has contained both classical and romantic elements - order and surprise, intellect and imagination, conscious and unconscious.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: From a very young age, stories fuelled my imagination in the most wonderful way.
data.author: Hayley Atwell

data.quote: We are all afraid for our confidence, for the future, for the world. That is the nature of the human imagination. Yet every man, every civilization, has gone forward because of its engagement with what it has set itself to do.
data.author: Jacob Bronowski

data.quote: Predating the Internet and predating videos, you had an active imagination. You would hear sounds and then get mental pictures of what these sounds felt like to you. It engaged you and made you more invested in it. It made you want to get tickets to the show, buy the album, put the poster on the wall. Now it's sensory overload.
data.author: Q-Tip

data.quote: I grew up in Sierra Leone, in a small village where as a boy my imagination was sparked by the oral tradition of storytelling. At a very young age I learned the importance of telling stories - I saw that stories are the most potent way of seeing anything we encounter in our lives, and how we can deal with living.
data.author: Ishmael Beah

data.quote: For imagination sets the goal picture which our automatic mechanism works on. We act, or fail to act, not because of will, as is so commonly believed, but because of imagination.
data.author: Maxwell Maltz

data.quote: Vision is the true creative rhythm.
data.author: Robert Delaunay

data.quote: Then I decided to draw from and on my own imagination, and everything came out perfect.
data.author: Jack Prelutsky

data.quote: We have the universe to roam in in imagination. It is our virtue to be infinitely varied. The worst tyranny is uniformity.
data.author: George William Russell

data.quote: History releases me from my own experience and jogs my fictional imagination.
data.author: Jennifer Gilmore

data.quote: Imagination is at the root of much that passes for love.
data.author: Gilbert Parker

data.quote: A person possessed with an idea cannot be reasoned with.
data.author: James Anthony Froude

data.quote: Writing for children isn't easy. Kids will abandon a story that doesn't interest, enchant, delight, thrill, or terrify them. But when you can find a way into a young reader's imagination through something as simple as words on paper, well, there's nothing more satisfying.
data.author: Kate Klise

data.quote: I've always had this in a kind of worst-case dark imagination. I want to know what the dark form in the window is. I want to know what the noise under the staircase is.
data.author: Lisa Unger

data.quote: I had been a reporter for 15 years when I set out to write my first novel. I knew how to research an article or profile a subject - skills that I assumed would be useless when it came to fiction. It was from my imagination that the characters in my story would emerge.
data.author: Amy Waldman

data.quote: Children do not give up their innate imagination, curiosity, dreaminess easily. You have to love them to get them to do that.
data.author: R. D. Laing

data.quote: My mother was making $135 a week, but she had resilience and imagination. She might take frozen vegetables, cook them with garlic, onion and Spam, and it would taste like a four-star dinner.
data.author: Andre Dubus III

data.quote: No, no, I don't watch football. The last time I tried watching was the last Super Bowl. The problem I have is, you know, the graphic nature of my imagination; when I watch and see them meeting head onto head, helmet onto helmet, what flashes through my mind is what's going on in their brains. It's like torture to me.
data.author: Bennet Omalu

data.quote: I love using my imagination. I love writing about animals.
data.author: Mary Pope Osborne

data.quote: I am imagination. I can see what the eyes cannot see. I can hear what the ears cannot hear. I can feel what the heart cannot feel.
data.author: Peter Nivio Zarlenga

data.quote: Never forget that the key to the situation lies in the will and not in the imagination.
data.author: Evelyn Underhill

data.quote: The American imagination has never been able to fully recover from its white-supremacist beginnings.
data.author: Claudia Rankine

data.quote: I have a darker imagination than most people.
data.author: Edan Lepucki

data.quote: Writers to some extent are childish, and it's at the childish level that one really engages with any experience. What really moves you is at the very personal, childish level of the imagination. My business is the imagination, and my imagination is engaged by Asia.
data.author: Christopher Koch

data.quote: Each one seems to be, in some way, essentially different from the others, and each is a surprise to me. I think that making books, or any kind of art, might also be like mining. The artist digs into his or her life and imagination and never knows what they'll find. That's the adventure.
data.author: Mordicai Gerstein

data.quote: I love the paranormal, because there, every genre I write can become one beacon for my imagination.
data.author: Leslie Banks

data.quote: Imagination is an instrument of survival.
data.author: Rogier van der Heide

data.quote: Imagination, the traitor of the mind, has taken my solitude and slain it.
data.author: Robinson Jeffers

data.quote: The imagination is a pretty precious source of protection.
data.author: Nicholas Ray

data.quote: Dreaming is an act of pure imagination, attesting in all men a creative power, which if it were available in waking, would make every man a Dante or Shakespeare.
data.author: Frederick Henry Hedge

data.quote: I consider myself very fortunate indeed to have created a character which has captured the imagination and enthusiasm of so many children worldwide. They are my family, and Spot belongs to them all.
data.author: Eric Hill

data.quote: Nowadays people's visual imagination is so much more sophisticated, so much more developed, particularly in young people, that now you can make an image which just slightly suggests something, they can make of it what they will.
data.author: Robert Doisneau

data.quote: I want to be on the screen, I want to play dress up every day, I want be different people, I want to have fun, and I want to use my imagination.
data.author: Skyler Samuels

data.quote: I am better able to imagine hell than heaven; it is my inheritance, I suppose.
data.author: Elinor Wylie

data.quote: Life would have been absolutely empty without imagination.
data.author: Jack Williamson

data.quote: In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: My eyes were made to erase all that is ugly.
data.author: Raoul Dufy

data.quote: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
data.author: Edgar Degas

data.quote: Art is the daughter of freedom.
data.author: Friedrich Schiller

data.quote: Riding a race bike is an art - a thing that you do because you feel something inside.
data.author: Valentino Rossi

data.quote: Art is not a thing it is a way.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: You use a glass mirror to see your face you use works of art to see your soul.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
data.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

data.quote: The greatness of art is not to find what is common but what is unique.
data.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

data.quote: My painting does not come from the easel.
data.author: Jackson Pollock

data.quote: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
data.author: Vincent Van Gogh

data.quote: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Art is not a handicraft, it is the transmission of feeling the artist has experienced.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: Advertising is the art of convincing people to spend money they don't have for something they don't need.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Creative without strategy is called 'art.' Creative with strategy is called 'advertising.'
data.author: Jef I. Richards

data.quote: I don't want life to imitate art. I want life to be art.
data.author: Ernst Fischer

data.quote: Where there is no human connection, there is no compassion. Without compassion, then community, commitment, loving-kindness, human understanding, and peace all shrivel. Individuals become isolated, the isolated turn cruel, and the tragic hovers in the forms of domestic and civil violence. Art and literature are antidotes to that.
data.author: Susan Vreeland

data.quote: Every human is an artist. And this is the main art that we have: the creation of our story.
data.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

data.quote: A picture is a poem without words.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: The art of simplicity is a puzzle of complexity.
data.author: Douglas Horton

data.quote: I prefer drawing to talking. Drawing is faster, and leaves less room for lies.
data.author: Le Corbusier

data.quote: Personality is everything in art and poetry.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: Insight is the first condition of Art.
data.author: George Henry Lewes

data.quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
data.author: Charles Bukowski

data.quote: Art is never finished, only abandoned.
data.author: Leonardo da Vinci

data.quote: The true artist is not proud: he unfortunately sees that art has no limits; he feels darkly how far he is from the goal, and though he may be admired by others, he is sad not to have reached that point to which his better genius only appears as a distant, guiding sun.
data.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

data.quote: Color is my day-long obsession, joy and torment.
data.author: Claude Monet

data.quote: Every painting is a voyage into a sacred harbour.
data.author: Giotto di Bondone

data.quote: Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy.
data.author: Isaac Newton

data.quote: The artist vocation is to send light into the human heart.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
data.author: Havelock Ellis

data.quote: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
data.author: Thomas Wolfe

data.quote: I'm giving into my tendency to want to blur and blend the lines between art and life, and privacy and sharing.
data.author: Lia Ices

data.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: To say the word Romanticism is to say modern art - that is, intimacy, spirituality, color, aspiration towards the infinite, expressed by every means available to the arts.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: To me, photography is an art of observation. It's about finding something interesting in an ordinary place... I've found it has little to do with the things you see and everything to do with the way you see them.
data.author: Elliott Erwitt

data.quote: Art is the most beautiful of all lies.
data.author: Claude Debussy

data.quote: Inspiration comes from everywhere: books, art, people on the street. It is an interior process for me.
data.author: Colleen Atwood

data.quote: If you're not trying to be real, you don't have to get it right. That's art.
data.author: Andy Warhol

data.quote: In art, there is no need for color; I see only light and shade. Give me a crayon, and I will paint your portrait.
data.author: Francisco Goya

data.quote: There are no contests in the Art of Peace. A true warrior is invincible because he or she contests with nothing. Defeat means to defeat the mind of contention that we harbor within.
data.author: Morihei Ueshiba

data.quote: I don't think about art when I'm working. I try to think about life.
data.author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

data.quote: A museum is a spiritual place. People lower their voices when they get close to art.
data.author: Mario Botta

data.quote: Rhetoric is the art of ruling the minds of men.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Pop Art looks out into the world. It doesn't look like a painting of something, it looks like the thing itself.
data.author: Roy Lichtenstein

data.quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: In mathematics the art of proposing a question must be held of higher value than solving it.
data.author: Georg Cantor

data.quote: It's very important that we re-learn the art of resting and relaxing. Not only does it help prevent the onset of many illnesses that develop through chronic tension and worrying; it allows us to clear our minds, focus, and find creative solutions to problems.
data.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

data.quote: Art is either plagiarism or revolution.
data.author: Paul Gauguin

data.quote: Diplomacy is the art of saying 'Nice doggie' until you can find a rock.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: True art is characterized by an irresistible urge in the creative artist.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: The wonders of the Grand Canyon cannot be adequately represented in symbols of speech, nor by speech itself. The resources of the graphic art are taxed beyond their powers in attempting to portray its features. Language and illustration combined must fail.
data.author: John Wesley Powell

data.quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Art should be an oasis: a place or refuge from the hardness of life.
data.author: Fernando Botero

data.quote: The walls between art and engineering exist only in our minds.
data.author: Theo Jansen

data.quote: Because advertising and marketing is an art, the solution to each new problem or challenge should begin with a blank canvas and an open mind, not with the nervous borrowings of other people's mediocrities. That's precisely what 'trends' are - a search for something 'safe' - and why a reliance on them leads to oblivion.
data.author: George Lois

data.quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: The art of a people is a true mirror to their minds.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: I like to change. A new lamp, a piece of art, can transform a room.
data.author: Madonna Ciccone

data.quote: There will be very few occasions when you are absolutely certain about anything. You will consistently be called upon to make decisions with limited information. That being the case, your goal should not be to eliminate uncertainty. Instead, you must develop the art of being clear in the face of uncertainty.
data.author: Andy Stanley

data.quote: I never know what I'm going to put on the canvas. The canvas paints itself. I'm just the middleman.
data.author: Peter Max

data.quote: Well, Art is Art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water. And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now you tell me what you know.
data.author: Groucho Marx

data.quote: The study of the art of motorcycle maintenance is really a miniature study of the art of rationality itself. Working on a motorcycle, working well, caring, is to become part of a process, to achieve an inner peace of mind. The motorcycle is primarily a mental phenomenon.
data.author: Robert M. Pirsig

data.quote: I believe the target of anything in life should be to do it so well that it becomes an art.
data.author: Arsene Wenger

data.quote: Painting is an infinitely minute part of my personality.
data.author: Salvador Dali

data.quote: Animation is not the art of drawings that move but the art of movements that are drawn.
data.author: Norman McLaren

data.quote: Drawing is like making an expressive gesture with the advantage of permanence.
data.author: Henri Matisse

data.quote: Art is the window to man's soul. Without it, he would never be able to see beyond his immediate world; nor could the world see the man within.
data.author: Lady Bird Johnson

data.quote: An artist must be free to choose what he does, certainly, but he must also never be afraid to do what he might choose.
data.author: Langston Hughes

data.quote: Art! Who comprehends her? With whom can one consult concerning this great goddess?
data.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

data.quote: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without the thorn.
data.author: Martin Amis

data.quote: The strangeness will wear off and I think we will discover the deeper meanings in modern art.
data.author: Jackson Pollock

data.quote: To an engineer, good enough means perfect. With an artist, there's no such thing as perfect.
data.author: Alexander Calder

data.quote: You can't do sketches enough. Sketch everything and keep your curiosity fresh.
data.author: John Singer Sargent

data.quote: The cinema is not a craft. It is an art. It does not mean teamwork. One is always alone on the set as before the blank page. And to be alone... means to ask questions. And to make films means to answer them.
data.author: Jean-Luc Godard

data.quote: There are no rules. That is how art is born, how breakthroughs happen. Go against the rules or ignore the rules. That is what invention is about.
data.author: Helen Frankenthaler

data.quote: It is the function of art to renew our perception. What we are familiar with we cease to see. The writer shakes up the familiar scene, and, as if by magic, we see a new meaning in it.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: Everyone discusses my art and pretends to understand, as if it were necessary to understand, when it is simply necessary to love.
data.author: Claude Monet

data.quote: Simplicity and repose are the qualities that measure the true value of any work of art.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: My art originates from hallucinations only I can see. I translate the hallucinations and obsessional images that plague me into sculptures and paintings.
data.author: Yayoi Kusama

data.quote: The artist who aims at perfection in everything achieves it in nothing.
data.author: Eugene Delacroix

data.quote: What art is, in reality, is this missing link, not the links which exist. It's not what you see that is art; art is the gap.
data.author: Marcel Duchamp

data.quote: To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.
data.author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

data.quote: With just one polka dot, nothing can be achieved. In the universe, there is the sun, the moon, the earth, and hundreds of millions of stars. All of us live in the unfathomable mystery and infinitude of the universe. Pursuing 'philosophy of the universe' through art under such circumstances has led me to what I call 'stereotypical repetition.'
data.author: Yayoi Kusama

data.quote: In art, at a certain level, there is no 'better than.' It's just about trying to operate for yourself on the most supreme level, artistically, that you can and hoping that people get it. Trusting that, just because of the way people are built and how interconnected we are, greatness will translate and symmetry will be recognised.
data.author: Frank Ocean

data.quote: A picture book is a small door to the enormous world of the visual arts, and they're often the first art a young person sees.
data.author: Tomie dePaola

data.quote: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
data.author: Paul Cezanne

data.quote: Art doesn't transform. It just plain forms.
data.author: Roy Lichtenstein

data.quote: The artist's job is to be a witness to his time in history.
data.author: Robert Rauschenberg

data.quote: 'Crazy' is a term of art; 'Insane' is a term of law. Remember that, and you will save yourself a lot of trouble.
data.author: Hunter S. Thompson

data.quote: All art is erotic.
data.author: Gustav Klimt

data.quote: There is only one valuable thing in art: the thing you cannot explain.
data.author: Georges Braque

data.quote: Rhetoric may be defined as the faculty of observing in any given case the available means of persuasion. This is not a function of any other art.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: The person who knows one thing and does it better than anyone else, even if it only be the art of raising lentils, receives the crown he merits. If he raises all his energy to that end, he is a benefactor of mankind and its rewarded as such.
data.author: Og Mandino

data.quote: Impressionism is the newspaper of the soul.
data.author: Henri Matisse

data.quote: There's no art to find the mind's construction in the face.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: For art to exist, for any sort of aesthetic activity to exist, a certain physiological precondition is indispensable: intoxication.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.

data.quote: When thou art at Rome, do as they do at Rome.

data.quote: Cleanliness is the scourge of art.

data.quote: Use the creative process - singing, writing, art, dance, whatever - to get to know yourself better.

data.quote: London, thou art the flower of cities all!

data.quote: Art is the fatal net which catches these strange moments on the wing like mysterious butterflies, fleeing the innocence and distraction of common men.

data.quote: The art of photography is all about directing the attention of the viewer.

data.quote: Art begins in imitation and ends in innovation.

data.quote: I just love pretty things, whether it is art, a song or a pair of shoes.

data.quote: Life is short, the art long.

data.quote: Logic: The art of thinking and reasoning in strict accordance with the limitations and incapacities of the human misunderstanding.

data.quote: My daughter loves to do art stuff. As a father, I like to play with her. We break out the big pads of paper and the glitter and all the stuff. She likes to do what she likes to do. I want to do something, too. So I've just started using her same materials - a lot of crayons, a lot of sparkle, charcoal, pencils, markers and glue.

data.quote: Parks are works of art just as a painting or sculpture is.

data.quote: I do not regard advertising as entertainment or an art form, but as a medium of information.

data.quote: Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.

data.quote: I paint with shapes.

data.quote: I really believe there are things nobody would see if I didn't photograph them.

data.quote: A beautiful body perishes, but a work of art dies not.

data.quote: Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.

data.quote: Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.

data.quote: I come from a real working class background, and I didn't know anyone sophisticated - except I saw Edie Sedgewick once at the Art Museum in Philly. data.quote: So many gods, so many creeds, so many paths that wind and wind while just the art of being kind is all the sad world needs.

data.quote: Yes, I believe that the art of winning is through intimidation, and not necessarily do you have to speak about it.

data.quote: The sadness of the incomplete, the sadness that is often Life, but should never be Art.
data.author: E. M. Forster

data.quote: Art is based on emotion, but being macho is based on ego; the wall protecting that emotion.

data.quote: Graffiti's always been a temporary art form. You make your mark and then they scrub it off.

data.quote: I make static art, not dynamic art. That's what I do.
data.author: Michael Heizer

data.quote: I love that works of art are printed so that anyone can buy them. The variety of what they put on little postcards astounds me.

data.quote: The job of art is to chase ugliness away.

data.quote: Back in third grade, they used to say, 'Take whatever talent you have and think of something you can do with it.' I liked to draw, but what could I do with it? Maybe I could be an art dealer - nah, can't see myself doing that. Maybe I could do commercial arts?
data.author: The Notorious B.I.G.

data.quote: All the great works of art, the cathedrals - the Gothic cathedrals and the splendid Baroque churches - are a luminous sign of God, and thus are truly a manifestation, an epiphany of God.
data.author: Pope Benedict XVI

data.quote: Art is the signature of civilizations.
data.author: Beverly Sills

data.quote: The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure very much.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Art is the symbol of the two noblest human efforts: to construct and to refrain from destruction.
data.author: Evelyn Waugh

data.quote: Every great work of art has two faces, one toward its own time and one toward the future, toward eternity.
data.author: Lester Bangs

data.quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Where thou art, that is home.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: The challenge is to practice politics as the art of making what appears to be impossible, possible.
data.author: Hillary Clinton

data.quote: The art of statesmanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence.
data.author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand

data.quote: Art is much less important than life, but what a poor life without it.
data.author: Robert Motherwell

data.quote: The art of government is the organisation of idolatry.

data.quote: The notion that the public accepts or rejects anything in modern art is merely romantic fiction. The game is completed and the trophies distributed long before the public knows what has happened.
data.author: Tom Wolfe

data.quote: The greater the decrease in the social significance of an art form, the sharper the distinction between criticism and enjoyment by the public. The conventional is uncritically enjoyed, and the truly new is criticized with aversion.

data.quote: They say Princes learn no art truly, but the art of horsemanship. The reason is, the brave beast is no flatterer. He will throw a prince as soon as his groom.

data.quote: Nothing right can be accomplished in art without enthusiasm.
data.author: Robert Schumann

data.quote: Good art however 'immoral' is wholly a thing of virtue. Good art can NOT be immoral. By good art I mean art that bears true witness, I mean the art that is most precise.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: If a patron buys from an artist who needs money, the patron then makes himself equal to the artist; he is building art into the world; he creates.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: We work in the dark - we do what we can - we give what we have. Our doubt is our passion and our passion is our task. The rest is the madness of art.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: It is not hard to understand modern art. If it hangs on a wall it's a painting, and if you can walk around it it's a sculpture.
data.author: Tom Stoppard

data.quote: The forms of art are inexhaustible but all lead by the same road of aesthetic emotion to the same world of aesthetic ecstasy.
data.author: Clive Bell

data.quote: Everything that is strong in me has gone into my art work.
data.author: Robert Crumb

data.quote: It's an art to live with pain... mix the light into gray.
data.author: Eddie Vedder

data.quote: Oh literature, oh the glorious Art, how it preys upon the marrow in our bones. It scoops the stuffing out of us, and chucks us aside. Alas!
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: All the world old is queer save thee and me, and even thou art a little queer.
data.author: Robert Owen

data.quote: No art is any good unless you can feel how it's put together. By and large it's the eye, the hand and if it's any good, you feel the body. Most of the best stuff seems to be a complete gesture, the totality of the artist's body; you can really lean on it.
