data.quote: The arts equally have distinct departments, and unless photography has its own possibilities of expression, separate from those of the other arts, it is merely a process, not an art.
data.author: Alfred Stieglitz

data.quote: Painting is an essentially concrete art and can only consist of the representation of real and existing things.
data.author: Gustave Courbet

data.quote: I think art is inherently nonviolent and it actually occupies your mind with creation rather than destruction.
data.author: Anthony Kiedis

data.quote: In any art, you don't know in advance what you want to say - it's revealed to you as you say it. That's the difference between art and illustration.
data.author: Aaron Siskind

data.quote: The art of life is to live in the present moment, and to make that moment as perfect as we can by the realization that we are the instruments and expression of God Himself.
data.author: Emmet Fox

data.quote: Tell me thy company, and I'll tell thee what thou art.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: I think body-image issues are not just a dancer thing. I think we're much more in tune and aware because the body is our instrument and art, and we stare at ourselves in a mirror all day, but I feel like it's something that every woman experiences and every girl experiences.
data.author: Misty Copeland

data.quote: It was Public Art, defined as art that is purchased by experts who are not spending their own personal money.
data.author: Dave Barry

data.quote: A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: Art for art's sake is a philosophy of the well-fed.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: What was any art but a mould in which to imprison for a moment the shining elusive element which is life itself - life hurrying past us and running away, too strong to stop, too sweet to lose.
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: The art of being a slave is to rule one's master.
data.author: Diogenes

data.quote: What marks the artist is his power to shape the material of pain we all have.
data.author: Lionel Trilling

data.quote: The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.
data.author: Jerzy Kosinski

data.quote: With color one obtains an energy that seems to stem from witchcraft.
data.author: Henri Matisse

data.quote: Art gives people a reason to be alive.
data.author: Marilyn Manson

data.quote: The concept of commercialism in the fashion and art world is looked down upon. You know, just to think, 'What amount of creativity does it take to make something that masses of people like?' And, 'How does creativity apply across the board?'
data.author: Kanye West

data.quote: All art is autobiographical. The pearl is the oyster's autobiography.
data.author: Federico Fellini

data.quote: Cinema is an art form that is designed to go across borders. And as a filmmaker, the only way I can direct a movie is when I feel close to my culture.
data.author: Denis Villeneuve

data.quote: I'm afraid that if you look at a thing long enough, it loses all of its meaning.
data.author: Andy Warhol

data.quote: In art, the obvious is a sin.
data.author: Edward Dmytryk

data.quote: An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.
data.author: James Whistler

data.quote: Jazz is known all over the world as an American musical art form and that's it. No America, no jazz. I've seen people try to connect it to other countries, for instance to Africa, but it doesn't have a damn thing to do with Africa.
data.author: Art Blakey

data.quote: The word 'art' interests me very much. If it comes from Sanskrit, as I've heard, it signifies 'making.' Now everyone makes something, and those who make things on a canvas with a frame, they're called artists. Formerly, they were called craftsmen, a term I prefer. We're all craftsmen, in civilian or military or artistic life.
data.author: Marcel Duchamp

data.quote: As humans we look at things and think about what we've looked at. We treasure it in a kind of private art gallery.
data.author: Thom Gunn

data.quote: Enjoying art is a personal matter. It's made up by contemplation, silence, abstraction.
data.author: Renzo Piano

data.quote: The sole art that suits me is that which, rising from unrest, tends toward serenity.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: The work of art is a scream of freedom.
data.author: Christo

data.quote: The basis of art is truth, both in matter and in mode.
data.author: Flannery O'Connor

data.quote: Architects, sculptors painters, we all must return to the crafts! For art is not a 'profession.' There is no essential difference between the artist and the craftsman. The artist is an exalted craftsman.
data.author: Walter Gropius

data.quote: To catch a husband is an art to hold him is a job.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: The art of living is the art of knowing how to believe lies.
data.author: Cesare Pavese

data.quote: Besides black art, there is only automation and mechanization.
data.author: Federico Garcia Lorca

data.quote: One thing that took a while to really adjust to was, you do it for the the art, for the money, for being together and having a good time, but you do it for all those people out there who really care about the show. We are now talking about a show we did over 20 years ago.
data.author: Steve Kanaly

data.quote: Art? That's a man's name.
data.author: Andy Warhol

data.quote: Art is the objectification of feeling.
data.author: Herman Melville

data.quote: The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
data.author: Frank Zappa

data.quote: Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.
data.author: Theodore Dreiser

data.quote: Impressionism it is the birth of Light in painting.
data.author: Robert Delaunay

data.quote: Japanese people accept that art and commerce will be blended; and, in fact, they are surprised by the rigid and pretentious Western hierarchy of 'high art.'
data.author: Takashi Murakami

data.quote: The fine art of preparing sushi is something that you watch and learn.
data.author: Nobu Matsuhisa

data.quote: There is no more difficult art to acquire than the art of observation, and for some men it is quite as difficult to record an observation in brief and plain language.
data.author: William Osler

data.quote: The art of reading between the lines is as old as manipulated information.
data.author: Serge Schmemann

data.quote: Works of art make rules rules do not make works of art.
data.author: Claude Debussy

data.quote: Any fool can have bad luck the art consists in knowing how to exploit it.
data.author: Frank Wedekind

data.quote: When you look at art made by other people, you see what you need to see in it.
data.author: Alberto Giacometti

data.quote: Actually I think Art lies in both directions - the broad strokes, big picture but on the other hand the minute examination of the apparently mundane. Seeing the whole world in a grain of sand, that kind of thing.
data.author: Peter Hammill

data.quote: But I am a lover of all kinds of art. And I just can't stick to one thing. I guess I could if I made myself, but I'd always be looking the other way, for other things.
data.author: Andre Benjamin

data.quote: I want to try and be as involved in the art of filmmaking as possible. I feel that the only way to really do that is to take on as many roles as possible, whether it be as an actor, an editor, a director, a cinematographer.
data.author: Joe Swanberg

data.quote: Art is solace; art is vision, and when I pick up a literary work, I am a consumer of literature for its own sake.
data.author: Wole Soyinka

data.quote: Art is permitted to survive only if it renounces the right to be different, and integrates itself into the omnipotent realm of the profane.
data.author: Theodor Adorno

data.quote: Take care to sell your horse before he dies. The art of life is passing losses on.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: The art of pleasing is the art of deception.
data.author: Luc de Clapiers

data.quote: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.
data.author: Stella Adler

data.quote: Every good painter paints what he is.
data.author: Jackson Pollock

data.quote: Art cannot be modern. Art is primordially eternal.
data.author: Egon Schiele

data.quote: The finest works of art are precious, among other reasons, because they make it possible for us to know, if only imperfectly and for a little while, what it actually feels like to think subtly and feel nobly.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want to own.
data.author: Andy Warhol

data.quote: An artist cannot fail it is a success to be one.
data.author: Charles Horton Cooley

data.quote: Art is like a border of flowers along the course of civilization.
data.author: Lincoln Steffens

data.quote: I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.
data.author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

data.quote: If you cannot learn to love real art, at least learn to hate sham art and reject it.
data.author: William Morris

data.quote: The marble not yet carved can hold the form of every thought the greatest artist has.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: I've always enjoyed feeling a connection to the avant-garde, such as Dada and surrealism and pop art. The only thing the artist can do is be honest with themselves and make the art they want to make. That's what I've always done.
data.author: Jeff Koons

data.quote: There's this shop in New York I go to it has bones and fossils and insects that are like works of art. I have a few on my wall.
data.author: Eva Green

data.quote: I love my Force Fins, which are the kind of fins Special Forces use and really are adapted from the fins of fish. They're very efficient. They are so beautiful, a pair is in the Museum of Modern Art. The set I have are ruby red. I call them my ruby flippers.
data.author: Sylvia Earle

data.quote: The art of the bird is to conceal its nest both as to position and as to material, but now and then it is betrayed into weaving into its structure showy and bizarre bits of this or that, which give its secret away and which seem to violate all the traditions of its kind.
data.author: John Burroughs

data.quote: Art is feminine... Look, if you're handsome and young and beautiful, well, people are always going to say that you're gay.
data.author: Juan Gabriel

data.quote: While I recognize the necessity for a basis of observed reality... true art lies in a reality that is felt.
data.author: Odilon Redon

data.quote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves 'It's pretty, but is it Art?'
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: Maturity implies otherness... The art of living is the art of living with.
data.author: Julius Gordon

data.quote: You should carefully study the Art of Reasoning, as it is what most people are very deficient in, and I know few things more disagreeable than to argue, or even converse with a man who has no idea of inductive and deductive philosophy.
data.author: William John Wills

data.quote: Artists today think of everything they do as a work of art. It is important to forget about what you are doing - then a work of art may happen.
data.author: Andrew Wyeth

data.quote: Anime is intended to have ambiguous features. That's part of the art form.
data.author: M. Night Shyamalan

data.quote: I always imagined myself somehow as an electron around some atom, and you're just, like, bouncing around and spinning. There was a never-ending supply of places to go, people to see, things to do, and fitting it all in became kind of an art.
data.author: Tom Freston

data.quote: What is extraordinary about contemporary art is the energy - it has our energy. New energy. Pieces hundreds of years old are beautiful from an aesthetic point of view, but without our modern energy.
data.author: Victor Pinchuk

data.quote: Making beautiful things for everyday use is a wonderful thing to do - making life flow more easily - but art confronts life, allowing it to stop and perhaps change direction - they are completely different.
data.author: Antony Gormley

data.quote: The thing is that as you grow through life, the pursuit of art and the pursuit of new ideas, all these things keeps your mind elastic.
data.author: Patti Smith

data.quote: Someone made me a Leaf Coneybear finger puppet. Someone made me a portrait of me on some chocolate. I'm keeping it. I daren't eat such a work of art. It's so unique and so fun that fans do that. It's incredibly flattering. I like it when people spend time on me. People don't spend the same amount of time on my brother who's an insurance broker.
data.author: Barrett Foa

data.quote: Literature is the art of writing something that will be read twice journalism what will be grasped at once.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: It is our art that has an opportunity to leave a footprint in the sand. They don't wrap fish in our work.
data.author: Hugh Newell Jacobsen

data.quote: Irresponsibility is part of the pleasure of all art it is the part the schools cannot recognize.
data.author: James Joyce

data.quote: We have lost the art of sharing and caring.
data.author: Hun Sen

data.quote: Art to me is an anecdote of the spirit, and the only means of making concrete the purpose of its varied quickness and stillness.
data.author: Mark Rothko

data.quote: But what does interest me is the notion that if you do a lot of work it means there's a potential for other people to understand that a lot of things are possible with a sustained effort and that the broadening of experiences is possible and I think that's all art can be.
data.author: Richard Serra

data.quote: Very few people possess true artistic ability. It is therefore both unseemly and unproductive to irritate the situation by making an effort. If you have a burning, restless urge to write or paint, simply eat something sweet and the feeling will pass.
data.author: Fran Lebowitz

data.quote: Masterpieces of art possess immense potential to advance a worldview that could help assuage the societal terrors posed by globalization, the most thoroughgoing socioeconomic upheaval since the Industrial Revolution, which has set off a pandemic of retrogressive nationalism, regional separatism, and religious extremism.
data.author: Martin Filler

data.quote: Film editing is now something almost everyone can do at a simple level and enjoy it, but to take it to a higher level requires the same dedication and persistence that any art form does.
data.author: Walter Murch

data.quote: We are only beginning to learn what to say in a photograph. The world we live in is a succession of fleeting moments, any one of which might say something significant.
data.author: Alfred Eisenstaedt

data.quote: Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: The mediator of the inexpressible is the work of art.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: Immature artists imitate. Mature artists steal.
data.author: Lionel Trilling

data.quote: With an apple I will astonish Paris.
data.author: Paul Cezanne

data.quote: It is not in life, but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.
data.author: Wilson Mizner

data.quote: All art is dependent on technology because it's a human endeavour, so even when you're using charcoal on a wall or designed the proscenium arch, that's technology.
data.author: George Lucas

data.quote: You begin with the possibilities of the material.
data.author: Robert Rauschenberg

data.quote: An empty canvas is full.
data.author: Robert Rauschenberg

data.quote: If I didn't choose art, I would have become an astronomer.
data.author: Peter Max

data.quote: I owe much to mother. She had an expert's understanding, but also approached art emotionally.
data.author: David Rockefeller

data.quote: I quickly realized that this medium had a lot to offer someone like me. To do Disney-quality hand-drawn cartoons, you have to be a master of two art forms. Seriously, you have to be able to draw like a Leonardo da Vinci or a Michelangelo. But also you have to know movement and timing and control that through 24 frames a second.
data.author: John Lasseter

data.quote: Art attracts us only by what it reveals of our most secret self.
data.author: Jean-Luc Godard

data.quote: For me, acting is about the art of it and it's about being on a film set and doing your thing, painting a blank canvas.
data.author: Shailene Woodley

data.quote: As long as you're true to you, you believe it and you make others believe it, then what you're doing is just art. If you give everybody a blank canvas and some paint, not everybody's picture is going to be exactly the same, but it's still art. I just do what I do.
data.author: Jake Owen

data.quote: I don't feel I'm trying to make art. I'm trying to make interesting things. People can relate to that.
data.author: Thomas Heatherwick

data.quote: My philosophy is that I'm an artist. I perform an art not with a paint brush or a camera. I perform with bodily movement. Instead of exhibiting my art in a museum or a book or on canvas, I exhibit my art in front of the multitudes.
data.author: Steve Prefontaine

data.quote: There is so much art can do to enlighten people, no matter what their views might be. If art can't go there or doesn't elevate the social consciousness in some way, then we are in peril.
data.author: Octavia Spencer

data.quote: In a storm, I think, 'What if the gospel be not true? Then thou art, of all men, most foolish. For what has thou given up thy goods, thy ease, thy friends, thy reputation, thy country, thy life?'
data.author: John Wesley

data.quote: I think of art, at its most significant, as a DEW line, a Distant Early Warning system that can always be relied on to tell the old culture what is beginning to happen to it.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: The reward of art is not fame or success but intoxication: that is why so many bad artists are unable to give it up.
data.author: Jean Cocteau

data.quote: In art and dream may you proceed with abandon. In life may you proceed with balance and stealth.
data.author: Patti Smith

data.quote: Winners have the ability to step back from the canvas of their lives like an artist gaining perspective. They make their lives a work of art - an individual masterpiece.
data.author: Denis Waitley

data.quote: Flirting is the gentle art of making a man feel pleased with himself.
data.author: Helen Rowland

data.quote: Homer has taught all other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Everyone thinks they can write a play you just write down what happened to you. But the art of it is drawing from all the moments of your life.
data.author: Neil Simon

data.quote: Every happening, great and small, is a parable whereby God speaks to us, and the art of life is to get the message.
data.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

data.quote: I think in art, but especially in films, people are trying to confirm their own existences.
data.author: Jim Morrison

data.quote: We should always remember that sensitiveness and emotion constitute the real content of a work of art.
data.author: Maurice Ravel

data.quote: The art of Peace I practice has room for each of the world's eight million gods, and I cooperate with them all. The God of Peace is very great and enjoins all that is divine and enlightened in every land.
data.author: Morihei Ueshiba

data.quote: To improve the golden moment of opportunity, and catch the good that is within our reach, is the great art of life.
data.author: William Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Part of the joy of looking at art is getting in sync in some ways with the decision-making process that the artist used and the record that's embedded in the work.
data.author: Chuck Close

data.quote: Extreme complication is contrary to art.
data.author: Claude Debussy

data.quote: Modernity is the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, which make up one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immutable. This transitory fugitive element, which is constantly changing, must not be despised or neglected.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Thou art not for the earth, nor for the Heaven the world is for thee, thou art not for the world.
data.author: Muhammad Iqbal

data.quote: How can anybody learn anything from an artwork when the piece of art only reflects the vanity of the artist and not reality?
data.author: Lou Reed

data.quote: When thou art above measure angry, bethink thee how momentary is man's life.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: The man of genius is he and he alone who finds such joy in his art that he will work at it come hell or high water.
data.author: Stendhal

data.quote: In art as in love, instinct is enough.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: Even a true artist does not always produce art.
data.author: Carroll O'Connor

data.quote: Pictures must not be too picturesque.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
data.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

data.quote: A good painting to me has always been like a friend. It keeps me company, comforts and inspires.
data.author: Hedy Lamarr

data.quote: Art is man's expression of his joy in labor.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: If we could but paint with the hand what we see with the eye.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: Advertising is the greatest art form of the 20th century.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: Wherever art appears, life disappears.
data.author: Robert Motherwell

data.quote: What is art but a way of seeing?
data.author: Saul Bellow

data.quote: A work of art has no importance whatever to society. It is only important to the individual.
data.author: Vladimir Nabokov

data.quote: An artist is forced by others to paint out of his own free will.
data.author: Willem de Kooning

data.quote: I think you can leave the arts, superior or inferior, to the conscience of mankind.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: Rules and models destroy genius and art.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: To be an artist includes much; one must possess many gifts - absolute gifts - which have not been acquired by one's own effort. And, moreover, to succeed, the artist much possess the courageous soul.
data.author: Kate Chopin

data.quote: Art depends on luck and talent.
data.author: Francis Ford Coppola

data.quote: To make pictures big is to make them more powerful.
data.author: Robert Mapplethorpe

data.quote: If you know somethin' well, you can always paint it but people would be better off buyin' chickens.
data.author: Grandma Moses

data.quote: The worst state of affairs is when science begins to concern itself with art.
data.author: Paul Klee

data.quote: What I wish to show when I paint is the way I see things with my eyes and in my heart.
data.author: Raoul Dufy

data.quote: Art is pattern informed by sensibility.
data.author: Herbert Read

data.quote: An empty canvas is a living wonder... far lovelier than certain pictures.
data.author: Wassily Kandinsky

data.quote: My paintings are not about what is seen. They are about what is known forever in the mind.
data.author: Agnes Martin

data.quote: I am not strong on perfection.
data.author: Jasper Johns

data.quote: The goal of art was the vital expression of self.
data.author: Alfred Stieglitz

data.quote: I realize that protest paintings are not exactly in vogue, but I've done many.
data.author: Robert Indiana

data.quote: Most art is fragile and some should be placed and never moved away.
data.author: Donald Judd

data.quote: The principle of art is to pause, not bypass.
data.author: Jerzy Kosinski

data.quote: Painting is the passage from the chaos of the emotions to the order of the possible.
data.author: Balthus

data.quote: There hasn't been any art yet. Art is just beginning.
data.author: Constantin Brancusi

data.quote: I will preach with my brush.
data.author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

data.quote: I see myself and many artists like me as the torchbearers through these dark ages.
data.author: John Zorn

data.quote: My hand is the extension of the thinking process - the creative process.
data.author: Tadao Ando

data.quote: In art, all who have done something other than their predecessors have merited the epithet of revolutionary; and it is they alone who are masters.
data.author: Paul Gauguin

data.quote: If you don't get noticed, you don't have anything. You just have to be noticed, but the art is in getting noticed naturally, without screaming or without tricks.
data.author: Leo Burnett

data.quote: What strikes me is the fact that in our society, art has become something which is only related to objects, and not to individuals, or to life.
data.author: Michel Foucault

data.quote: Art is dangerous. It is one of the attractions: when it ceases to be dangerous you don't want it.
data.author: Duke Ellington

data.quote: One of the most striking signs of the decay of art is when we see its separate forms jumbled together.
data.author: Jean-Luc Godard

data.quote: Art comes to you proposing frankly to give nothing but the highest quality to your moments as they pass.
data.author: Walter Pater

data.quote: The art of politics consists in knowing precisely when it is necessary to hit an opponent slightly below the belt.
data.author: Konrad Adenauer

data.quote: There is in fact no such thing as art for art's sake, art that stands above classes, art that is detached from or independent of politics. Proletarian literature and art are part of the whole proletarian revolutionary cause.
data.author: Mao Zedong

data.quote: To my mind the old masters are not art their value is in their scarcity.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: Infatuated, half through conceit, half through love of my art, I achieve the impossible working as no one else ever works.
data.author: Alexandre Dumas

data.quote: So long as the system of competition in the production and exchange of the means of life goes on, the degradation of the arts will go on; and if that system is to last for ever, then art is doomed, and will surely die; that is to say, civilization will die.
data.author: William Morris

data.quote: All art is quite useless.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Interpretation is the revenge of the intellectual upon art.
data.author: Susan Sontag

data.quote: Modernity is the transient, the fleeting, the contingent; it is one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immovable.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Life is like art. You have to work hard to keep it simple and still have meaning.
data.author: Charles de Lint

data.quote: If thou art master to thyself, circumstances shall harm thee little.
data.author: Martin Farquhar Tupper

data.quote: I mean, art for art's sake is ridiculous. Art is for the sake of one's needs.
data.author: Carl Andre

data.quote: Every time you work, you have to do it all over again, to rid yourself of this dross. I suppose for a person who is not an artist or not attempting art, it is not dross, because it is the common exchange of everyday life.
data.author: Carl Andre

data.quote: Performance art is the ultimate in creativity. Since it has so many possibilities at creativity, it's essence tends to become creativity.
data.author: Jack Bowman

data.quote: Every mind which has given itself to self-expression in art is aware of a directing agency outside its conscious control which it has agreed to label 'inspiration'.
data.author: Norman Lindsay

data.quote: Salesmanship, too, is an art; the perfection of its technique requires study and practice.
data.author: James Cash Penney

data.quote: When it came to my art, I went my own way and did not follow the trends.
data.author: Frank Frazetta

data.quote: I don't really believe in 'directions' in art; the rope twists as you follow it, that's all.
data.author: Graham Nelson

data.quote: Although all the good arts serve to draw man's mind away from vices and lead it toward better things, this function can be more fully performed by this art, which also provides extraordinary intellectual pleasure.
data.author: Nicolaus Copernicus

data.quote: There's room for the Gap, but the joy of dressing is an art.
data.author: John Galliano

data.quote: The biggest problem with every art is by the use of appearance to create a loftier reality.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.
data.author: Khalil Gibran

data.quote: The true art of memory is the art of attention.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Without freedom, no art; art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Fashion is only the attempt to realize art in living forms and social intercourse.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: Thou must be emptied of that wherewith thou art full, that thou mayest be filled with that whereof thou art empty.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Photograph: a picture painted by the sun without instruction in art.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Painting, n.: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: What I didn't know was I was deeply attracted to the big space.
data.author: David Hockney

data.quote: Art is parasitic on life, just as criticism is parasitic on art.
data.author: Harry S Truman

data.quote: I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.
data.author: Francis Ford Coppola

data.quote: The business of art is to reveal the relation between man and his environment.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: I can't bear art that you can walk round and admire. A book should be either a bandit or a rebel or a man in the crowd.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: Evil is done without effort, naturally, it is the working of fate; good is always the product of an art.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: The waking mind is the least serviceable in the arts.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: I think an artist's responsibility is more complex than people realize.
data.author: Jodie Foster

data.quote: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.
data.author: Marcel Duchamp

data.quote: In seeking wisdom thou art wise in imagining that thou hast attained it - thou art a fool.
data.author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

data.quote: To make us feel small in the right way is a function of art men can only make us feel small in the wrong way.
data.author: E. M. Forster

data.quote: Trying to force creativity is never good.
data.author: Sarah McLachlan

data.quote: Art is an invention of aesthetics, which in turn is an invention of philosophers... What we call art is a game.
data.author: Octavio Paz

data.quote: That's the motivation of an artist - to seek attention of some kind.
data.author: James Taylor

data.quote: The more horrifying this world becomes, the more art becomes abstract.
data.author: Ellen Key

data.quote: Some people act as though art that is for a mass audience is not good art, and I think this has been a very negative thing. I know that I have wanted very much to write books that are accessible to the widest audience possible.
data.author: bell hooks

data.quote: I always feel like the art's there and I just see it, so it's not really a lot of work.
data.author: Damien Hirst

data.quote: I think it's pretentious to create art just for the sake of stroking the artists ego.
data.author: Lou Reed

data.quote: Of all lies, art is the least untrue.
data.author: Gustave Flaubert

data.quote: Art: If the object of poetry is, to make men, then poetry is the heir of prophecy.
data.author: Muhammad Iqbal

data.quote: The writer, when he is also an artist, is someone who admits what others don't dare reveal.
data.author: Elia Kazan

data.quote: What makes photography a strange invention is that its primary raw materials are light and time.
data.author: John Berger

data.quote: No heirloom of humankind captures the past as do art and language.
data.author: Theodore Bikel

data.quote: Any work that aspires, however humbly, to the condition of art should carry its justification in every line.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: I love the gallery, the arena of representation. It's a commercial world, and morality is based generally around economics, and that's taking place in the art gallery.
data.author: Jeff Koons

data.quote: Like art and politics, gangsterism is a very important avenue of assimilation into society.
data.author: E. L. Doctorow

data.quote: It's clever, but is it Art?
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: Art produces ugly things which frequently become more beautiful with time. Fashion, on the other hand, produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time.
data.author: Jean Cocteau

data.quote: Thou art my single day, God lends to leaven What were all earth else, with a feel of heaven.
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: Every artist writes his own autobiography.
data.author: Havelock Ellis

data.quote: The worse my drawings were, the more beautiful did the originals appear.
data.author: John James Audubon

data.quote: I don't understand it. Jack will spend any amount of money to buy votes but he balks at investing a thousand dollars in a beautiful painting.
data.author: Jackie Kennedy

data.quote: I think you learn a lot about a country from its art. To me, it's part of the drama of life. It teaches you that there are places, moments and incidents in other cultures that genuinely have a life of their own.
data.author: Michael Palin

data.quote: Art begins with resistance - at the point where resistance is overcome. No human masterpiece has ever been created without great labor.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: There is no prejudice that the work of art does not finally overcome.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Art is the collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: All great art is born of the metropolis.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: The art of living lies not in eliminating but in growing with troubles.
data.author: Bernard Baruch

data.quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
data.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

data.quote: The vitality of a new movement in Art must be gauged by the fury it arouses.
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: The artist one day falls through a hole in the brambles, and from that moment he is following the dark rapids of an underground river which may sometimes flow so near to the surface that the laughing picnic parties are heard above.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: I'm just really impressed by oil paintings - I don't see how people do it! That's the style I like: classic oil paintings. Abstract art just isn't my thing.
data.author: Brittany Howard

data.quote: True art selects and paraphrases, but seldom gives a verbatim translation.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: The perfection of art is to conceal art.
data.author: Quintilian

data.quote: I've never really had a hobby, unless you count art, which the IRS once told me I had to declare as a hobby since I hadn't made money with it.
data.author: Laurie Anderson

data.quote: Artists don't make objects. Artists make mythologies.
data.author: Anish Kapoor

data.quote: Time extracts various values from a painter's work. When these values are exhausted the pictures are forgotten, and the more a picture has to give, the greater it is.
data.author: Henri Matisse

data.quote: An artist never really finishes his work, he merely abandons it.
data.author: Paul Valery

data.quote: Painting and writing are solitary arts.
data.author: Conrad Hall

data.quote: Art is one thing that can go on mattering once it has stopped hurting.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: Art is subject to arbitrary fashion.
data.author: Kary Mullis

data.quote: Art is the final cunning of the human soul which would rather do anything than face the gods.
data.author: Iris Murdoch

data.quote: All art is a struggle to be, in a particular sort of way, virtuous.
data.author: Iris Murdoch

data.quote: And as I reinvent myself and I'm constantly curious about everything, I can't wait to see what's around the corner in newfound art and entertainment and exploration.
data.author: Pam Grier

data.quote: Artists themselves are not confined, but their output is.
data.author: Robert Smithson

data.quote: I'm not gonna give the British Government the joy of keeping taxing me. They don't tax art. And all my cars are just a collection of art.
data.author: Jay Kay

data.quote: Advertising is the art of the tiny. You have to tell a complete a story and deliver a complete message in a very encapsulated form. It disciplines you to cut away extraneous information.
data.author: Dick Wolf

data.quote: Art distills sensations and embodies it with enhanced meaning.
data.author: Miguel de Unamuno

data.quote: The best artists know what to leave out.
data.author: Charles de Lint

data.quote: Mournful and yet grand is the destiny of the artist.
data.author: Franz Liszt

data.quote: To write is to become disinterested. There is a certain renunciation in art.
data.author: Anthony Burgess

data.quote: A great artist can paint a great picture on a small canvas.
data.author: Charles Dudley Warner

data.quote: It is a mistake for a sculptor or a painter to speak or write very often about his job. It releases tension needed for his work.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: Discipline in art is a fundamental struggle to understand oneself, as much as to understand what one is drawing.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: When artists make art, they shouldn't question whether it is permissible to do one thing or another.
data.author: Sol LeWitt

data.quote: People were more interested in the phenomena than the art itself. This, combined with the growing interest in collecting art as an investment and the resultant boom in the art market, made it a difficult time for a young artist to remain sincere without becoming cynical.
data.author: Keith Haring

data.quote: I cry out for order and find it only in art.
data.author: Helen Hayes

data.quote: Art must take reality by surprise.
data.author: Francoise Sagan

data.quote: A performance art piece is unprecedented. It is difficult to censor since it has a good possibility of never being done before.
data.author: Jack Bowman

data.quote: The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.
data.author: Novalis

data.quote: When I make art, I think about its ability to connect with others, to bring them into the process.
data.author: Jim Hodges

data.quote: Of what use were the arts if they were only the reproduction and the imitation of life?
data.author: Alfred de Vigny

data.quote: It has taken me years of struggle, hard work and research to learn to make one simple gesture, and I know enough about the art of writing to realize that it would take as many years of concentrated effort to write one simple, beautiful sentence.
data.author: Isadora Duncan

data.quote: Art is a revolt against fate. All art is a revolt against man's fate.
data.author: Andre Malraux

data.quote: When looking at any significant work of art, remember that a more significant one probably has had to be sacrificed.
data.author: Paul Klee

data.quote: Paint the essential character of things.
data.author: Camille Pissarro

data.quote: I just started making Bloody Marys. I always thought they looked gross, then I tasted one. There's an art to it, from the Tabasco to the Worcestershire.
data.author: Tara Reid

data.quote: The creative act lasts but a brief moment, a lightning instant of give-and-take, just long enough for you to level the camera and to trap the fleeting prey in your little box.
data.author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

data.quote: Great artists suffer for the people.
data.author: Marvin Gaye

data.quote: Draw your pleasure, paint your pleasure, and express your pleasure strongly.
data.author: Pierre Bonnard

data.quote: It is the mark of great art that its appeal is universal and eternal.
data.author: Clive Bell

data.quote: Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
data.author: Amy Lowell

data.quote: It's an old ploy of the bourgeoisie. They keep a standing 'art' to defend their collapsing culture.
data.author: George Grosz

data.quote: Photography is a major force in explaining man to man.
data.author: Edward Steichen

data.quote: When that shutter clicks, anything else that can be done afterward is not worth consideration.
data.author: Edward Steichen

data.quote: Every other artist begins with a blank canvas, a piece of paper the photographer begins with the finished product.
data.author: Edward Steichen

data.quote: A room hung with pictures is a room hung with thoughts.
data.author: Joshua Reynolds

data.quote: I want to make exalted art. A successful image has pictorial lift. I am looking for whatever is up there.
data.author: Frank Stella

data.quote: An artist carries on throughout his life a mysterious, uninterrupted conversation with his public.
data.author: Maurice Chevalier

data.quote: Art thou the King of the Jews?
data.author: Pontius Pilate

data.quote: Contrary to general belief, an artist is never ahead of his time but most people are far behind theirs.
data.author: Edgard Varese

data.quote: To paint is a possessing rather than a picturing.
data.author: Philip Guston

data.quote: Painting seems like some kind of peculiar miracle that I need to have again and again.
data.author: Philip Guston

data.quote: One must always draw, draw with the eyes, when one cannot draw with a pencil.
data.author: Balthus

data.quote: Art is Art. Everything else is everything else.
data.author: Ad Reinhardt

data.quote: Art is too serious to be taken seriously.
data.author: Ad Reinhardt

data.quote: I decided on the spot that I would be an artist, and I assure you, it was no ordinary artist I had in mind.
data.author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

data.quote: Art is anything people do with distinction.
data.author: Louis Dudek

data.quote: The art of using deceit and cunning grow continually weaker and less effective to the user.
data.author: John Tillotson

data.quote: Great art is never produced for its own sake. It is too difficult to be worth the effort.
data.author: Robert Quillen

data.quote: It is more important to click with people than to click the shutter.
data.author: Alfred Eisenstaedt

data.quote: I think of my peace paintings as one long poem, with each painting being a single stanza.
data.author: Robert Indiana

data.quote: I was the least Pop of all the Pop artists.
data.author: Robert Indiana

data.quote: Artists don't talk about art. Artists talk about work. If I have anything to say to young writers, it's stop thinking of writing as art. Think of it as work.
data.author: Paddy Chayefsky

data.quote: My art springs from my desire to have things in the world which would otherwise never be there.
data.author: Carl Andre

data.quote: Real art is one of the most powerful forces in the rise of mankind, and he who renders it accessible to as many people as possible is a benefactor of humanity.
data.author: Zoltan Kodaly

data.quote: As I very much liked to draw and paint as a child, I entered a special art program in high school, which was very much like being in an art school imbedded in a regular high school curriculum.
data.author: Jerome Isaac Friedman

data.quote: To me that's what art is about - when you don't really have any control over your desires to do it.
data.author: Noah Taylor

data.quote: Great art is an instant arrested in eternity.
data.author: James Huneker

data.quote: Every picture shows a spot with which the artist has fallen in love.
data.author: Alfred Sisley

data.quote: There is always a multitude of reasons both in favor of doing a thing and against doing it. The art of debate lies in presenting them the art of life lies in neglecting ninety-nine hundredths of them.
data.author: Hale White

data.quote: I take photographs with love, so I try to make them art objects. But I make them for myself first and foremost - that is important.
data.author: Jacques-Henri Lartigue

data.quote: Art is a liaison between some sort of deranged mentality and others who are not going through it.
data.author: John Chamberlain

data.quote: The arts are an even better barometer of what is happening in our world than the stock market or the debates in congress.
data.author: Hendrik Willem Van Loon

data.quote: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: Politics have no relation to morals.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.
data.author: Plato
